question:
Select the phrase(s) from the given three options which can be used to form a single sentence from the two sentences given below, implying the same meaning as expressed in the statement sentences. The given options may or may not be starters.

The first museum of weights and measures in the country sits in the Chamarajpeth market area of Karnataka. Called Tula Bhavan, its exhibits include more than 3,000 varieties of weighing and measuring devices, some dating back at least three centuries.

1. Has exhibits including __________________

2. With exhibits including ___________________

3. Tula Bhavan, the first ___________________
solution:
1 is possible. The first museum of weights and measures in the country which sits in the Chamarajpeth market area of Karnataka is called Tula Bhavan, and has exhibits including more than 3,000 varieties of weighing and measuring devices, some dating back at least three centuries.

2 is possible. With exhibits including more than 3,000 varieties of weighing and measuring devices, some dating back at least three centuries the first museum of weights and measures in the country sits in the Chamarajpeth market area of Karnataka and is called Tula Bhavan.

3 is possible. Tula Bhavan, the first museum of weights and measures in the country sits in the Chamarajpeth market area of Karnataka having exhibits that include more than 3,000 varieties of weighing and measuring devices, some dating back at least three centuries.

So, option e) is the right answer.

question:
Select the phrase(s) from the given three options which can be used to form a single sentence from the two sentences given below, implying the same meaning as expressed in the statement sentences. The given options may or may not be starters.

Physical checks of youth in the streets has added an element of deterrence. This is analogous to the 'stop and frisk' practice of the NYPD, whose focus on the non-white population has often drawn flak.

1. Which is analogous ________________

2. Analogous to the _________________

3. Since this is analogous _________________
solution:
1 is possible. Physical checks of youth in the streets has added an element of deterrence, which is analogous to the 'stop and frisk' practice of the NYPD, whose focus on the non-white population has often drawn flak.

2 is possible. Analogous to the 'stop and frisk' practice of the NYPD, whose focus on the non-white population has often drawn flak, an element of deterrence has been added by the physical checks of youth in the streets.

3 is not possible. 'Since' is used to show a causational relationship between statements, while the two statements here are sequential, not causational.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. Part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts have an error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Market-based economies tend / to allow goods (A)/ to flowing freely (B)/ through the market (C)/ according to supply and demand. (D)
solution:
In this case, the error is in part (B) because the infinitive marker 'to' is followed by the verb in base form (V1). Thus, 'flowing' (V4, i.e., -ing form of verb) must be replaced with 'flow' to make the sentence grammatically correct. Therefore, option (a) is the correct answer.

Note:

Infinitive marker: A word or affix attached to the stem of a verb in order to form the full infinitive. In English, to is the infinitive marker.

Infinitive: The infinitive is the base form of a verb, often preceded by to.

Consider the sentences given below:

· To err is human. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to err' is the subject of the verb 'is']

· My father likes to cook. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to cook' is the object of the verb 'likes']

· To vote in elections is our right. [the infinitive 'to vote', like a noun, is the subject of the verb 'is', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (elections)]

· Radha went to the lake to fetch water. [the infinitive 'to fetch', like a noun, is the object of the verb 'went', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (water)]

· The above sentences illustrate various ways in which infinitives are used. It can both act as a noun and a verb.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. Part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts have an error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Many students / is waiting (A)/ to get (B)/ admission in (C)/ renowned universities (D).
solution:
'Students' is a plural subject and should be followed by the plural verb, whereas 'is' is a singular verb. This is a violation of the subject-verb agreement rule. Replace 'is' in part A with the plural verb 'are' to rectify the error.

Therefore, the correct answer is option (c).

Note: Subject-Verb Agreement: Matching up singular or plural subjects with singular or plural forms of a verb is part of the process called agreement. This can be understood better by the examples given: - "She likes cooking." [singular subject and verb] -- "They like to cook vegetables." [plural subject and verb]

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. Part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts have an error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The number of accidents (A)/ has been increasing worldwide / for the last two decades, (B)/ but the government does not seems (C)/ to be acting proportionately (D).
solution:
The verbs, do, does, did are followed by base verbs (V1), whereas 'seems' is the third-person singular form (V5) of the verb. It should be replaced with 'seem' (V1) to rectify the error. 'Seem' means to give the impression of being or doing something; to appear.

Therefore, the correct answer is option (d).

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with a phrase highlighted in bold. Select the option given below that can replace the phrase in bold to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct and mark that as your answer. If the sentence is correct as it is, mark 'No correction required', as the answer.

Let I be assured that everyone without those people taken into consideration, there is no question of further movement on this line.
option_1: Let me assure everybody that without doors to doors
option_2: Let me be assured by days after days that till these people are considered
option_3: Let me assure that until every men and women are considered
option_4: Let me assure everyone that without taking people into confidence
solution:
We cannot use the subjective pronoun 'I' after 'let'. 'Let' only takes objective pronouns like me, him, them, etc. So, the highlighted part of the sentence is incorrect.

In phrases like 'door to door' and 'day after day' (where the same noun follows and precedes the preposition), singular nouns are used. According to this, we can eliminate options (a) and (b). The determiner 'every' only takes singular nouns. So, the phrase 'every men and women' is incorrect. So, option (c) is also incorrect. Among the given options, option (d) is the correct choice.

The correct sentence is: Let me assure everyone that without taking people into confidence, there is no question of further movement on this line.

Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

Note:

Determiner: A modifying word that determines the kind of reference a noun or noun group has, for example, 'a', 'the', 'every', 'much', 'many', etc.

question:
In the question given below, a sentence is given with one blank, followed by five options, each having two words that may or may not fit in the blanks. Choose the one that gives the correct words that fit in the blank.

We have felt the energy shift when _______ in a positive state of mind enters a room, and the mood lightens.
solution:
The blank requires a pronoun that denotes the person who enters a room with a positive state of mind.

Among the options, only option (c), 'somebody' (some person) and 'anyone' (any person or people) suggest both words as pronouns. The rest of the options have at least one word unsuitable [funny and reluctant are adjectives while relatively and absolutely are adverbs] and are thus negated.

The complete sentences are:

We have felt the energy shift when somebody in a positive state of mind enters a room, and the mood lightens.

We have felt the energy shift when anyone in a positive state of mind enters a room, and the mood lightens.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

question:
In the question given below, a sentence is given with one blank, followed by five options, each having two words that may or may not fit in the blanks. Choose the one that gives the correct words that fit in the blank.

Net zero means no longer adding to the total _______ of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.
solution:
The blank requires a noun that is modified by the adjective 'total' and denotes something that is related to greenhouse gases.

'Currency' is a noun but it doesn't match the context of the sentence. 'Available' (able to be used or obtained) is an adjective, 'largely' (to a great extent) and 'fully' (completely) are adverbs so these words cannot be used in the blank and are thus negated.

'Amount' (a quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent) and 'quantity' (the amount or number of a material or abstract thing not usually estimated by spatial measurement) are the nouns that the blank requires to denote the greenhouse gases.

The complete sentences are:

Net zero means no longer adding to the total amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

Net zero means no longer adding to the total quantity of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

Note:

Modifier: A word, especially an adjective or noun used attributively, that restricts or adds to the sense of a head noun. Example: "A strong (adj.) table"; "The safety (noun) barrier"

question:
In the question given below, a sentence is given with one blank, followed by five options, each having two words that may or may not fit in the blanks. Choose the one that gives the correct words that fit in the blank.

Decisions must be holistic, taking into account not just yourself but also the ______ for others.
solution:
The blank requires a noun that indicates what should be considered while deciding if other people are involved too.

'Holistically' (in a way that is characterized by the belief that the parts of something are intimately interconnected and explicable only by reference to the whole) is an adverb, 'minding' (take care of temporarily) is a verb, 'ourselves' is a reflexive pronoun and 'boiling' is a verb/adjective/noun (at or near boiling point). These words do not fit the blank grammatically and are thus negated.

'Consequences'(a result or effect, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant) and 'implications' (a likely consequence of something) are the nouns that match the context of the sentence and can thus fill the given blank as required.

The complete sentences are:

Decisions must be holistic, taking into account not just yourself but also the implications for others

Decisions must be holistic, taking into account not just yourself but also the consequences for others

Hence, the correct answer is option (e).

Note:

Reflexive Pronouns: Reflexive pronouns include myself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, yourselves, and themselves. These are used to refer back to the subject of the clause in which they are used: She hurt herself in the eye.

question:
In the question below, a sentence is given with one blank, followed by five options, each having two words which may or may not fit in the blank. From the given options, choose the one that gives the correct pair of words that fit in the blank.

Tommy lost the shopping list his mother had ___ him and just bought items he wanted to eat.
solution:
The given sentence talks about a person named Tommy who lost the shopping list his mother had written for him. The blank requires past participle form of verb, after the helping verb 'had'. Among the given options, the pair of 'given' and 'handed' fits in the blank appropriately. 'Given' means freely transferred the possession of something to someone. 'Handed' means picked something up to pass it to someone. Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

The rest of the options have words which either don't fit in contextually or are not past participle form of verb.

question:
Directions:

Directions : A set of sentences is given, which when properly sequenced, forms a coherent passage. Arrange the sentences in the correct sequence and answer the questions that follow.

A. After understanding all of that we can infer, that the quest for personal development and change does not imply malcontent.

B. As a conclusion, it instead suggests the ubiquitous human need to improve.

C. On a more concrete level, we may need to exercise three days a week, consume less alcohol, or lose 20 pounds.

D. Many of us want to be different and we may desire to be more extroverted, spontaneous, or productive.

E. Additionally, one scientific fact we know for sure is that when we want to change our personalities, we have both the capacity and the ability.



Which of the following will be the FIRST sentence after rearrangement?
solution:
The correct order is DCEAB. D is first as it begins the discussion about people desiring to be different and bringing in a change in them. C is next as it explains things 'on a more concrete level' (exemplifies some of the ways to be different). E follows next as it is an addition to the previous statement C as evidenced by adverb 'additionally'. A is next as it starts with the phrase, 'After understanding all of that we can infer..' suggesting an inference from previous statements. B is the concluding statement as it has the phrase, 'as a conclusion'.

Words that describe a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or even a sentence as a whole are called Adverbs.

Adverb of Manner: It tells us how an action is performed or how an event occurs.

Examples: walked briskly, listening quietly.


As per the rearrangement sequence, statement 'D' is the FIRST sentence and thus option (c) is the correct answer.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. Part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts have an error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

From the steaming pots and (A)/ kettles in front at the fireplace, (B)/ savoury odours risen that (C)/ tickled the palate and rouse (D)/ the dormant appetite.
solution:
A - no error.

B - the preposition 'of' should be used in the construction 'in front of', as it is being used to describe the physical placement of something with respect to the fireplace.

C - the simple past tense of the verb 'rose' should be used here. The third form of the verb 'risen' can be used with the helping verbs 'had' or 'have'.

D - following the rules of parallelism, the simple past tense of the verb 'roused' should be used along with the verb 'tickled'.

Hence, (a) is the right answer.

Note: Parallelism: In grammar, parallelism, also known as parallel structure or parallel construction, is a balance within one or more sentences of similar phrases or clauses that have the same grammatical structure. Given below is an example which shows a sentence in two forms (parallel in structure and lacking parallelism): Lacking parallelism: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and to sing. Parallel: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and singing.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. Part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts have an error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The current high level of air pollution/ has shortened the average lifespan of a South Asian child (A)/ by two-and-a-half years while (B)/ global the reduction stands at 20 months, (C)/ according to a global study. (D)
solution: In part C, the adverb 'globally' should have been used to qualify the verb 'stands'. 'Global' is an adjective. Option A is the right answer.

question:
In the following question, the highlighted word is used in three sentences, either as it or in different forms. Find which of the sentences has/have correct usage of the word and mark the answer accordingly.

Image

I. Our librarian informed us that the replication of images from the college website is strictly prohibited.

II. Selena projected a public image that wasn't purely fictional but had a heavily invented element to it.

III. Phil has a habit of interrupting image people while they are talking on their phones.
solution:
'Image' means 'a visual representation (of an object or scene or person or abstraction) produced on a surface; the general impression that something (a person or organization or product) presents to the public; a standard or typical example'.

Statement I: The sentence talks about replication of something from the college website. Here, 'images' acts as a noun that means 'a visual representation produced on a surface'. It is grammatically and contextually correct.

Statement II: The sentence talks about Selena's portrayal of something to the public. Here, 'image' acts as a noun that means 'the general impression that a person presents to the public'. It is grammatically and contextually correct.

Statement III: The sentence talks about Phil's habit of interrupting people. 'Image' does not fit in the context. It can simply be removed to make the sentence meaningful.

Hence, the answer is option c).

question:
In the given question, a word has been given and there are three ways in which the word has been used, in similar or different forms. You need to see which of the sentences has/have correctly used the highlighted word, and mark that as your answer.

STOCK

I. A buffer stock of grain was held in case of emergency shortages.

II. I'm afraid we're temporarily out of stock.

III. Crocodiles have been known to actively stock and kill humans.
solution:
'Stock' means the merchandise that a shop has on hand or a supply of something available for future use.

The use of 'stock' is correct in sentences I and II. However, the use of 'stalk (to follow a person over a period of time in a frightening or annoying way)' in place of 'stock' would be correct in sentence III as it gives context that the crocodile follows humans to kill them.

So, I and II are correct sentences.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with a phrase highlighted in bold. Select the option given below that can replace the phrase in bold to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct and mark that as your answer. If the sentence is correct as it is, mark 'No correction required', as the answer.

My department drew up the short straw on re-location and from tomorrow we get to work in remote location of Earlsfield in the London borough for seven weeks.
solution: The correct usage of the phrase is 'draw the short straw', which means 'be the unluckiest of a group of people, especially in being chosen to perform an unpleasant task'. So, B is the right answer.

question:
In the question given below, a sentence is given with a phrase highlighted in bold. Find out the phrase, among the phrases (a, b, c, d) given below the sentence, should replace the phrase printed in bold to make the sentence grammatically correct. If the sentence is already correct, mark (e), i.e. 'No correction required', as the answer.

The separation of society from nature has led to the emergence of a framework that rationalised the unbridle exploitation of nature.
solution: The highlighted part is incorrect as the noun 'exploitation' cannot be modified by a verb i.e. 'unbridle'. This eliminates options b) and c) also. In option a) use of 'rationalise' is incorrect as with a singular noun 'framework', a singular form of verb i.e. 'rationalises' is used. This eliminates option a). In option d) use of 'rationalises' and 'unbridled' (which is an adjective and modifies the noun 'exploitation') is correct. Hence, the answer is option d).

question:
Which of the following phrases given below should replace the phrase highlighted in bold to make the sentence grammatically correct? In case of a grammatically correct sentence, mark 'No replacement required.

Many buildings are torn down in the quest for modernization, only for the loss in building heritage to being mourned afterwards.
option_1: loss of built heritage to being
option_2: loss of building heritage to be
option_3: loss of built heritage to be
solution: Using 'to being' is incorrect in option 1. 'Building heritage' will mean that the heritage is getting built, which will be incorrect. Using loss 'in' built heritage does not make ay sense, as in option 4. Option 3 is the correct choice.

question:
In the given question, a word has been given and there are three ways in which the word has been used, in similar or different forms. You need to see which of the sentences has/have correctly used the highlighted word, and mark that as your answer.

Separate

I. There is a separate room in the house, which is exclusively allocated for exquisite art collections.

II. The old lady knows how to separate the husk from the paddy grain.

III. Degradable waste is separate kept from non-degradable waste.
solution:
The word 'separate' means 'forming or viewed as a unit apart or by itself (adjective)', 'divide into constituent or distinct elements (verb)'.

Statement I - In this sentence, the word 'separate' acts as an adjective, and it qualifies the noun 'room'.

Statement II- In this sentence, the word 'separate' acts as a verb that denotes 'divide into constituent or distinct elements'. Its use is contextually and grammatically correct.

Statement III- In this sentence, the word 'separate' is grammatically incorrect as the verb 'kept' requires an adverb instead of an adjective to qualify it. So, 'separately' would be correct.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with certain words marked as (A), (B), (C), (D) and (E). Choose the options with the sequence that makes the sentence grammatically and contextually correct. If no change is required, mark E 'No change required' as your answer.

The recent wildfires (A) of news stories about rash (B) has implied wildfires are burning (C) more frequent and getting (D) more intensely, fuelled (E) by climate change.
solution:
The phrases 'wildfires of news stories', 'rash has implied wildfires' and 'getting more intensely' are incoherent and not at all meaningful. 'Burning more intensely' is a meaningful phrase (indicating the degree of burning) so 'burning' should be interchanged with 'getting'. Also, swapping 'wildfires' and 'rash' would make the sentence meaningful as, here, 'rash' is used to convey the series of news stories of wildfires. The remaining word 'fuelled' is correct at its place.

Correct sentence:

The recent rash of news stories about wildfires has implied wildfires are getting more frequent and burning more intensely, fuelled by climate change.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with certain words marked as (A), (B), (C), (D) and (E). Choose the options with the correct sequence of words to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct. If no change is required, mark E 'No change required' as your answer.

A lot of we (A) felt there were no brands (B) out there that catered to their skin (C) tone- It was light, medium, medium dark, dark and reality (D) all know that's not women (E).
solution:
Subjective pronoun 'we' is incorrectly use at A where either an objective pronoun can fit in or a noun to act as the object of the clause 'a lot of ___'. Since 'reality' is an abstract noun that cannot know or understand a thing, its usage at D is absurd. Also, 'women' at E is not able to convey any logical meaning. Again, 'reality' cannot 'feel' so the only noun left to place at A is 'women' that would convey that the feelings of those women. Similarly, 'we' would be the subject of the clause '___ all know'. And, 'reality' would be placed at E. Rest of the words are correct and meaningful at their original places.

Correct sentence:

A lot of women felt there were no brands out there that catered to their skin tone- It was light, medium, medium dark, dark and we all know that's not reality.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with certain words marked as (A), (B), (C), (D) and (E). Choose the options with the correct sequence of words to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct. If no change is required, mark E 'No change required' as your answer.

Some people helps (A) that having a set time every day (B) - right before morning (C), first thing in the bed (D), just after a workout - find (E) establish a habit.
solution:
Singular verb 'helps' is incorrectly used with the plural noun 'people' so it must be swapped with a plural verb and the only plural verb among the highlighted words is 'find', so 'find' would be placed at A and 'helps' would be used at E. The sentence is about setting time for different tasks in every day routine, for which the sentence intends to convey different time slots with different tasks. But, both the phrases 'right before morning' and 'first thing in the bed' refer to the same time slot, i.e., night which is repetitive. If, 'morning' and 'bed' are interchanged, new phrases would be 'right before bed' and 'first thing in the morning' which would convey the night and day, respectively. Rest of the words are correctly used at their places.

Correct sentence:

Some people find that having a set time every day - right before bed, first thing in the morning, just after a workout - helps establish a habit.

Hence, option (c) is correct.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Read the following passage carefully and answer the question that follows.

Mosquitoes are members of a group of about 3,500 species of small flies within the family Culicidae. The word "mosquito" is Spanish for "little fly". Mosquitoes have a slender segmented body, one pair of wings, one pair of halteres, three pairs of long hair-like legs, and elongated mouthparts. When we are young, we learn that tigers and sharks are dangerous animals. We might be scared of them because they are very large and have enough strength. As we get older, however, we learn that sometimes the most dangerous animals are also the smallest animals.

In fact, the animal that kills the most people every year is one that you have probably killed yourself many times: the mosquito. While it may seem that all mosquitoes are biters, this is not actually the case. Male mosquitoes eat plant nectar, on the other hand, female mosquitoes feed on animal blood. They need this blood to live and produce eggs. When a female mosquito bites a human being, it transmits a small amount of saliva into the blood. This saliva may or may not contain a deadly disease. The result of the bite can be as minor as an itchy bump or as serious as death because a mosquito can bite many people in the course of its life, it can carry diseases from one person to another very easily.

Two of the deadliest diseases carried by mosquitoes are malaria and yellow fever. More than 700 million people become sick from these diseases every year. At least 2 million of these people will die from these diseases. Many scientists are working on safer and better ways to kill mosquitoes, but so far, there is no sure way to protect everyone in the world from their deadly bites. (A) Mosquito nets can (B) be placed over (C) beds to protect people (D) against being biting. These nets help people stay safe at night, but they do not kill any mosquitoes. Mosquitoes have many natural enemies like bats, birds, dragonflies, and certain kinds of fish that kill mosquitoes.

Bringing more of these animals into places where mosquitoes live might help in _________ the number of mosquitoes in that area. This is a natural solution, but it does not always work very well. Mosquitoes can also be killed with poisons or sprays. Even though these sprays kill mosquitoes, they may also harm other plants or animals. Although mosquitoes may not seem as scary as larger, more powerful animals, they are far more dangerous to human beings. But things are changing. It is highly likely that one day scientists will find a way to keep everyone safe from mosquitoes and the diseases they carry.



According to the author, some people are more afraid of tigers and sharks than mosquitoes because tigers and sharks
option_3: are found all over the world
solution:
In the first paragraph the author says, 'we might be scared of them because they are very large and have enough strength' so the reason mentioned in option (b) is appropriate.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

Based on the information mentioned in the passage, we can understand that

I. male mosquitoes and female mosquitoes have different eating patterns.

II. male mosquitoes are harmless to humans.

III. female mosquitoes are not responsible for transmitting diseases to humans.
solution:
In paragraph 2 the author writes, 'male mosquitoes eat plant nectar. On the other hand, female mosquitoes feed on animal blood.' Using this information, we can understand that male mosquitoes and female mosquitoes have different eating habits. This supports statement I.

In paragraph 2 the author writes, 'when a female mosquito bites a human being, it transmits a small amount of saliva into the blood. This saliva may or may not contain a deadly disease.' Since male mosquitoes eat plant nectar (and not animal blood), and it is the bite that causes the transmission of diseases, we can understand that male mosquitoes do not bite humans. Therefore, they are harmless to humans. This supports statement II.

In paragraph 2 the author writes, 'when a female mosquito bites a human being, it transmits a small amount of saliva into the blood. This saliva may or may not contain a deadly disease.' We can understand that female mosquitoes are responsible for transmitting diseases to humans. This does not support statement III.

Hence, option (c) is correct.

Which of the following words best describes the author's overall attitude towards the prospect of solving the mosquito problem?
option_2: exasperated, meaning extremely irritated or annoyed
option_4: optimistic, meaning hopeful or taking a favourable view
solution:
In the final paragraph the author concludes the passage by saying, 'but things are changing. It is highly likely that one day scientists will find a way to keep everyone safe from mosquitoes and the diseases they carry.' This lets us know that although the problem may look grim now, there is a good chance that scientists will be able to solve it in the future. Thus, the author's attitude towards the prospect of solving the mosquito problem can best be described as optimistic. Therefore (d) is correct.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

solution:

Bringing more of these animals into places where mosquitoes live might help in _________ the number of mosquitoes in that area. This is a natural solution, but it does not always work very well. Mosquitoes can also be killed with poisons or sprays. Even though these sprays kill mosquitoes, they may also harm other plants or animals. Although mosquitoes may not seem as scary as larger, more powerful animals, they are far more dangerous to human beings. But things are changing. It is highly likely that one day scientists will find a way to keep everyone safe from mosquitoes and the diseases they carry.



Find which part of the sentence contain an error and mark your option accordingly. Mark (e) in case of no error.

(A) Mosquito nets can (B) be placed over (C) beds to protect people (D)against being biting.
solution:
The sentence is given in passive voice so we should use participle form of form verb after being ('base form of verb + ing' in active voice changes to 'being + past participle').

Example-

Active voice- She is preparing dinner for them.

Passive voice- Dinner is being prepared by her for them.

So, 'being biting' will be replaced with 'being bitten'.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

Participle: A word formed from a verb (e.g. going, gone, being, been) and used as an adjective (e.g. working woman, burnt toast) or a noun (e.g. good breeding). In English participles are also used to make compound verb forms (e.g. is going, has been). Consider the sentences given below:

Dancing at the party, the women fell on the ground.

Encouraged by her parents, Rita went on to pursue her passion.

The highlighted word in the first sentence is of the form Verb + ing and is used as a present participle. It is used to denote an action that is going on or incomplete or imperfect.

The highlighted word in the second sentence is of the form verb + ed. It is used as a past participle. It denotes completed action or state of the thing spoken of.

A past participle ends with the following: -ed, -d, -t, -en, or -n.

question:
Directions:

Directions :In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by blanks that are represented by letters. Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follow.

Online shopping has become a __A___ practice in recent years, but the real question is if it's environmentally sustainable? As we move towards the future, we need to ___B___ towards more environmentally conscious decisions and try our level best in looking out for the best interests of our planet. Due to centuries worth of resource exploitation, poor planning, and lack of knowledge, a substantial amount of ___C___ has already been caused to the Earth. Now that we do know better, we must make decisions in the best interest of the Earth. It might seem small and ___D___ at an individual level, but you can indeed make a big difference even with these "small" deeds. With a little bit of ____E____ and some awareness of your actions, you can go a long way. You can even inspire others to follow in the same footsteps and, ignite a wildfire of environmentally responsible behaviours. In this way, even little efforts like these on an individual level can lead to change on a considerable scale if enough individuals ___F___ them in their daily lives.



Which of the following words can fit in blank A?
solution:
The blank requires an adjective to qualify the noun 'practice'. Option a) is eliminated as it is a noun. Options d) and e) are eliminated as they are verbs. Option b) is an adjective but it is a contextual misfit. The sentence talks about online shopping gaining popularity. 'False practice' does not impart any such meaning to the sentence. Thus, option b) is eliminated. Option c) is an adjective and means 'accepted, used, or practiced by most people'. It appropriately defines the practice of online shopping.

Hence, the answer is option c).

question:
Directions:

Directions :In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by blanks that are represented by letters. Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follow.

Online shopping has become a __A___ practice in recent years, but the real question is if it's environmentally sustainable? As we move towards the future, we need to ___B___ towards more environmentally conscious decisions and try our level best in looking out for the best interests of our planet. Due to centuries worth of resource exploitation, poor planning, and lack of knowledge, a substantial amount of ___C___ has already been caused to the Earth. Now that we do know better, we must make decisions in the best interest of the Earth. It might seem small and ___D___ at an individual level, but you can indeed make a big difference even with these "small" deeds. With a little bit of ____E____ and some awareness of your actions, you can go a long way. You can even inspire others to follow in the same footsteps and, ignite a wildfire of environmentally responsible behaviours. In this way, even little efforts like these on an individual level can lead to change on a considerable scale if enough individuals ___F___ them in their daily lives.



Which of the following words can fit in blank D?
solution:
The blank requires an adjective to describe how one's efforts might seem at an individual level. Option b) is eliminated as it is an adverb. Option c) is eliminated as it is a noun. Option e) is eliminated as it is a verb. Option a) is an adjective but it is a contextual misfit. The phrase preceding the blank is "small and". 'Small' and 'crucial' are somewhat opposite in meaning. They cannot be joined by the conjunction 'and' (which is used to join similar words and phrases). The adjective 'insignificant' means 'lacking importance' and is relatively close in meaning to 'small'. Thus, it is an appropriate fit.

Hence, the answer is option d).

In this way, even little efforts like these on an individual level can lead to change on a considerable scale if enough individuals ___F___ them in their daily lives.



Which of the following words can fit in blank E?
solution:
The blank is preceded by the preposition 'of' indicating that the required word is a noun. Options d) and e) are eliminated as they are adverb and verb respectively. Options a) and c) are nouns but they are contextual misfits. In the sentence, the author suggests ways to contribute towards the environment. Such a suggestion cannot have negative connotation. Options a) and c) have negative connotation and are, thus, eliminated. Option b) has a positive connotation and is an appropriate fit.

Hence, the answer is option b).

Which of the following words can fit in blank F?
solution:
The blank requires a verb to join the noun 'individuals' and the pronoun 'them'. Options a), c) and e) are eliminated as they are adjectives. Option d) is eliminated as it is a contextual misfit. The blank requires a verb that can meaningfully refer to the noun 'efforts'. 'To believe efforts' is not the intended meaning. 'To practise efforts' is more meaningful. Thus, 'practise' is the appropriate fit.

Hence, the answer is option b).

Mahesh marked up an article 40% above its cost price and while selling the article he offers 20% discount on marked price. If he earns Rs. 960 as a profit, then what is the discount given by him to the customer?

The average runs scored by two batsman A and B in 7 innings are 27 and 39 respectively. If their average in the next innings is increased by 3 and 2 respectively, then what is the difference between runs scored by both of them in 8th inning?
solution:
Let the average runs scored by A and B in 8th inning are 'a' and 'b' respectively. then,

For A:

27 * 7 + a = (27 + 3) * 8 => a = 51

For B:

39 * 7 + b = (39 + 2) * 8 => b = 55

Therefore, difference between runs scored by both of them in 8th inning = b - a = 55 - 51 = 4

question: A certain sum of money when deposited at 10% per annum compound interest for 2 years amounts to Rs 11,000 more than when it is deposited at 10% simple interest for 1 year. What is the sum of money?
solution:
Let the sum of money be Rs 'x'.

Rs 'x' when invested at the rate of 10% per annum compound interest, it amounts to x(1 + 10/100)2 = 1.12 * x = Rs 1.21x

Rs 'x' when invested at the rate of 10% per annum simple interest, it amounts to

x + x*1*10/100 = Rs 1.1x

Given, 1.21x - 1.1x = 11000

=> 0.11x = 11000

=> x = Rs 1,00,000.

question:
In the following question, two statement numbered I and II are given. On solving them, we get two quantities quantity I and quantity II respectively. Compare both the quantities and choose the correct answer:

A and B together can complete a piece of work in 7.5 days and B and C together can complete the same work in 5
5_________11
days

Quantity I: If A is 40% less efficient than B, then in how many days A and C together can complete the work?

Quantity II: If C is 20% more efficient than B, then in how many days A and C together can complete the work?
option_5: Quantity I = Quantity II or relationship cannot be established
solution:
1/A + 1/B = 2/15 ---(1)

And, 1/B + 1/C = 11/60 ---(2)

Quantity I:

Ratio of efficiency of A and B = 60: 100 = 3: 5

Let 1/A = 3x and 1/B = 5x

So, from equation (1), we get

3x + 5x = 2/15

=> x = 1/8 * 2/15 = 1/60

So, A = 60/3 = 20 days

And, B = 60/5 = 12 days

Thus, C = 1/(11/60 - 1/12) = 10 days

So, A and C together can complete the work in = 1/(1/20 + 1/10) = 6(2/3) days

Quantity II:

Now, Ratio of efficiency of C and B = 120: 100 = 6: 5

Let 1/C = 6x and 1/B = 5x

6x + 5x = 11/60

=> x = 1/60

So, C = 60/6 =10 days and, B = 60/5 = 12 days

Thus, A = 1/(2/15 - 1/12) = 20 days

So, A and C together can complete the work in = 1/(1/20 + 1/10) = 6(2/3) days

Hence, Quantity I = Quantity II

question: Present age of Kamal is three years younger than Rajat's present age and present age of Rajat is 2 years younger than Tanuj's present age. The difference between cubes of Rajat's present age and cubes of Tanuj's present age is 488. The ratio of Kamal's age after 10 years and Shivam's age after 11 years is 3:5 respectively, then find the present age of Shivam.
solution:
Let the present age of Kamal, Rajat and Tanuj be 'p' years, 'p+3' years and 'p+5' years respectively.

(p + 5)3 - (p + 3)3 = 488

15p2 + 125 + 75p - 9p2 - 27 - 27p = 488

p2 + 8p - 65 = 0

(p + 13)(p - 5) = 0

p = -13, 5

Since age can't be negative.

So, p = 5 years

Present age of Kamal, Rajat and Tanuj be 5 years, 8 years and 10 years respectively.

Let present age of Shivam = 'n' years

Now, (5 + 10)/(n + 11) = 3/5

n = 25 - 11

n = 14 years

question:
In the following question, two statement numbered I and II are given. On solving them, we get two quantities quantity I and quantity II respectively. Compare both the quantities and choose the correct answer:

Average age of A, B and C is 12 years and after 6 years the ratio of A and C is 5: 7.

Quantity I: If after 3 years, the ratio of age of B and A is 5: 4, what is present age of A?

Quantity II: If A is 3 years younger than B, then what is the present age of C?
option_5: Quantity I = Quantity II or relationship cannot be established
solution:
A + B + C = 36 ---(1)

(A + 6)/(C + 6) = 5/7

=> C = (7A + 12)/5 ---(2)

Quantity I:

(B + 3)/(A + 3) = 5/4

=> B = (5A + 3)/4 ---(3)

From equation (1), (2) and (3), we get

A + (5A + 3)/4 + (7A + 12)/5 = 36

=> A = 9 years

So, B = 12 years and C = 15 years

Quantity II:

A + 3 = B ---(4)

From equation (1), (2) and (4), we get

A + A + 3 + (7A + 12)/5 = 36

=> A = 9 years

Hence, C = 15 years

Thus, Quantity A < Quantity B

question: A team of 8 men and 10 women can finish a work in 12 days while another team of 12 men and 5 women can finish the same work in 10 days. Find the number of days in which a team of 6 men and 20 women can complete the whole work together.
solution:
Let the part of work done by 1 man and 1 woman in a day is 'm' and 'w' respectively.

(8m + 10w)*12 = (12m + 5w)*10

96m + 120w = 120m + 50w

24m = 70w

m = 35w/12

Now,

Let 6m and 20w can complete the work in 'd' days.

(6m + 20w)d = (8m + 10w)*12

(35w/2 + 20w)d = (70/3w + 10w)*12

d = 800/75

d = 32/3 days

question: A total 840 km distance covered by two cars A and B in total 20.5 hours such that car A covers 480 km distance and remaining distance is covered by car B. If speed of car B is 45 km/hr, then find the speed of car A.
solution:
Let speed of car A = s km/hr

Then, 20.5 = (480/s) + (840 - 480)/45

s = 38.4 km/hr

question: There are two types of mustard oils - type A and type B. One mixture contains type A and type B mustard oil in ratio 2: 3 and second mixture contains type A and type B mustard oil in ratio 7: 3. In what ratio should both mixtures be mixed to get a resultant mixture having type A and type B mustard oil in the ratio of 4: 1?
solution:
The resultant mixture has the type A mustard oil% as 4/5* 100 = 80%, which is more than the % of any of the mixing mixture.

One mixture has type A mustard oil% as 2/5* 100 = 40%

Second mixture has type A mustard oil% as 7/10* 100 = 70%

This means that 40% mixture cannot be mixed with 70% mixture in any manner to get 80% mixture.

Directions :Read the data carefully and answer the following questions.

The table given below shows the ratio of the number of male to the number of female participants in five different sports events in the London games and the total number of participants in the respective events.

Events Total number of participants Ratio of the number of male to female participants
100 - meter sprint5405 : 4
200 - meter sprint7503 : 2
400 - meter relay9002 : 1
Shot put7706 : 5
Marathon5604 : 3


The number of male participants who participated in Shot Put is how much percent more/less than the number of female participants who participated in 200 - meter Sprint?
solution:
Total number of participants of 100 - meter sprint = 540

Number of male participants = 5/9 * 540 = 300

Number of female participants = 540 - 300 = 240

Similarly we can find others also,

Events Total number of participants Male Female
100 - meter sprint540300240
200 - meter sprint750450300
400 - meter relay900600300
Shot put770420350
Marathon560320240


Required percentage = (420 - 300)/300 * 100 = 40%

question: In Delhi, 60% of the people have metro card. 34% of the people having metro card are female and 64% of the people not having metro card are male. The males having metro card is what percentage more or less females not having metro card?
solution:
Let total number of people in Delhi = x

The number of people who have metro cards = 0.6x

The number of males having metro card = (100 - 34)/100 * 0.6x = 0.396x

The number of female not having metro card = (100 - 64)/100 * 0.4x = 0.144x

So, required % = (0.396x - 0.144x)/0.144x * 100 = 252/144 * 100 = 175%

question: The length of the rectangle is 25% more than the diameter of a circle and breadth of the rectangle is 50% more than the radius of the circle. What is the area of the rectangle if the circumference of the circle is 144π cm?
solution:
The circumference of the circle is 144π cm

So, radius of the circle = 144/2 = 72 cm

Thus, length = 125/100 * 144 = 180 cm

And, breadth = 150/100 * 72 = 108 cm

Hence, Area of the rectangle = 180 * 108 = 19440 cm2

question: If the first five digits are arranged in ascending order which is followed by the last five digits are arranged in the ascending order from left to right of the number '2546149876', then the smallest two digits number so formed without repetition by using the two digits which are exactly in the middle of the number so formed is _______.
solution:
The given number is 2546149876.

If the first five digits are arranged in ascending order which is followed by the last five digits are arranged in the ascending order from left to right, the number so formed is 1245646789.

The middle two digits are 1245646789.

The smallest two digits number formed is 46.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Six women namely Chitra, Gargi, Gauri, Divya, Bimla and Ekta are sitting around a circular table and discussing the colours they like. Each one of them likes different colours i.e., Green, Red, Yellow, Purple, Pink and Blue, but not necessarily in the same order. All are facing outside the circle.

Ekta sits adjacent to the one who likes the Red colour. Two people sit between the one who likes the red colour and Bimla. Divya sits immediately to the right of Bimla. Gauri does not sit adjacent to Ekta. Chitra does not like red and yellow colour. Bimla does not like Yellow or Blue colours. Divya and Gauri like Pink and Purple colour respectively. The one who likes Blue colour does not sit adjacent to the one who likes Purple colour.



Who among the following likes the Yellow colour?
solution:
· Six women namely Chitra, Gargi, Gauri, Divya, Bimla and Ekta are sitting around a circular table and discussing the colour they like. Each one of them likes different colours i.e., Green, Red, Yellow, Purple, Pink and Blue, but not necessarily in the same order. All are facing outside the circle.

· Ekta sits adjacent to the one who likes the Red colour.

· Two people sit between the one who likes the red colour and Bimla.

· Divya sits immediately to the right of Bimla.

· So, there are two cases possible i.e., case 1 and Case 2.

· Gauri does not sit adjacent to Ekta.

· Chitra does not like red and yellow colour.

· So, Case 1 will further have two cases i.e., Case 1(a) and Case 1(b).

· Bimla does not like Yellow or Blue colours.

· Divya and Gauri like Pink and Purple colour respectively.

· The one who likes Blue colour does not sit adjacent to the one who likes Purple colour.

· So, Case 1(a) and Case 1(b) will be invalid.

Finally, we get,


Ekta likes the yellow colour.

K was discovered immediately before P. V was discovered in an even-numbered year, but after H. Two stars were discovered in between Z and K. S is older than W. Difference between present ages of H and K is 11 years. The difference between the present ages of V and W is even number. Z was discovered after 2010. W is older than Z.



Which star was discovered immediately after P?
solution:
V was discovered in an even-numbered year, but after H. hence can't be in 1988.

Case 1Case 2
1988
1997
1999
2009
2014V
2017
2018V

The difference between the present ages of V and W is even number.

Hence, W must also be discovered in the even-numbered year.

In case 1, it must be in 2018 or 1988.

2018 - 2014 = 4

2014 - 1988 = 26

In case 2, it must be in 2014 or 1988.

But, since, S is older than W, hence, W can't be discovered the very first i.e. in 1988.

Case 1Case 2
1988
1997
1999
2009
2014VW
2017
2018WV

The difference between the present ages of H and K is 11 years.

Only possibility is 1999 - 1988 = 11

We get,

Case 1Case 2
1988H/KH/K
1997
1999K/HK/H
2009
2014VW
2017
2018WV

K was discovered immediately before P.

Two stars were discovered in between Z and K.

Z was discovered after 2010.

We get,

Case 1Case 2
1988HH
1997
1999KK
2009PP
2014VW
2017ZZ
2018WV

Since W is older to Z, hence case 1 becomes invalid.

We get,

1988H32 years
1997S23 years
1999K21 years
2009P11 years
2014W6 years
2017Z3 years
2018V2 years


W was discovered immediately after P.

question:
Study the given information and answer the following question based on it.

In a certain code language,

fly high and jump is coded as WRS DQH NDP ACB

birds fly very high is coded as JUY ACB CZE DQH

animals jump very fast is coded as MNC WRS JUY DRS

Which of the following is coded as 'NDP'?
solution:
And is coded as 'NDP. Hence, 'c' is the correct option.

We know -

fly high and jump is coded as WRS DQH NDP ACB...... (i)

birds fly very high is coded as JUY ACB CZE DQH........(ii)

animals jump very fast is coded as MNC WRS JUY DRS.........(iii)

From (ii) and (iii) we get -

Very - JUY .... (iv)

From (i) and (iii) we get -

Jump - WRS

From (i), (ii) and (iv) we get -

Fly - DQH/ACB

High - DQH/ACB

And - NDP

M and J live on the same floor.

There are two floors between the ones on which J and X live where X lives above J.

question:
In the following question, statements and conclusions are given. Choose the correct option with conclusions that logically do not follow.

Statement:

All branded are new.

Some new are old.

No old are dirty.

Only shirt is dirty.

Conclusions:

I. Some shirt are old.

II. Some branded are old is a possibility.

III. No new is dirty.
solution:
Some shirt are old is false. Hence, 'c' is the correct option.

The given statements are -

All branded are new.

Some new are old.

No old are dirty.

Only shirt is dirty.

Now, the conclusions are -

I. Some shirt are old - No relation between shirt and old. So, this is false.

II. Some branded are old is a possibility - By the second figure we conclude that some branded are old is a possibility. So, this is true.

III. No new is dirty - since only shirt is dirty hence no new is dirty. So, this is true .

question:
In the following question, statements and conclusions are given. Choose the correct option with conclusions that logically do not follow.

Statement:

Some monkey are donkey.

No donkey is owl.

All owl are innocent.

Only a few bat are owl.

Conclusions:

I. Some bat are innocent.

II. Some monkey can be bat.

III. All owl are donkey.
solution:
All owl are donkey is false. Hence, 'd' is the correct option.

The given statements are -

Some monkey are donkey.

No donkey is owl.

All owl are innocent.

Only a few bat are owl.

Now, from the conclusion we know that -

I. Some bat are innocent - All owl are innocent and only a few bat are owl. So, some bat are innocent. Hence, this is true.

II. Some monkey can be bat - Here we see in the second figure that all monkey can be bat. Hence, this is true.

III. All owl are donkey - No donkey is owl so all owl cannot be donkey. Hence, this is false.

question:

Statement: D = E ≥ T > M ≥ P; C < H ≤ M = L

Conclusions:

I. P ≤ L

II. C < E
solution:
M = L

M ≥ P

So, P ≤ L

Hence, I follow.

C < H ≤ M

E ≥ T > M

So, C < E

Hence, II follow.

solution:
Q < R

N < C ≤ Q < R

question:
In the question below, a statement is followed by two conclusions based on the statement. Study the conclusions and select the correct option as the answer.

Statement: P < O > Y = S ≥ C < L; Q = F ≥ Y

Conclusion I: Q > C

Conclusion II: Q = C
solution:
Given statement is P < O > Y = S ≥ C < L; Q = F ≥ Y

Q = F ≥ Y = S ≥ C

Here the common sign between Q and C is '≥'.

Hence, Q ≥ C

So, either Q > C or Q = C.

Thus, either conclusion I or conclusion II follows.

solution:
D is at the corner and facing north. R is a neighbour of D. R is sitting second to the left of N.

T is sitting to the immediate right of N.

C is sitting third to the right of O.

But R is sitting towards the left of C. So, case 2 is invalid.

C is not sitting at the corner.

The final arrangement is thus:

So, O is the one facing south.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Eight cold drink cans marked as A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H have different temperatures. Can G has 7 degree temperature which is more than the temperature of exactly three cans. Only two cans have more temperature than can B. Can A has 13 degree temperature which is immediately higher than the temperature of can D. The temperature of can H is more than the temperature of can F but less than the temperature of can G. The temperature of can E is more than the temperature of can H but less than the temperature of can C.



How many cans have less temperature than the temperature of can E?
solution:
Can G has 7 degree temperature which is more than the temperature of exactly three cans. Only two cans have more temperature than can B.

_____ > _____> B > _____ > G(7) > _____ > _____> _____

Can A has 13 degree temperature which is immediately higher than the temperature of can D.

A(13) > D > B > _____ > G(7) > _____ > _____> _____

The temperature of can H is more than the temperature of can F but less than the temperature of can G.

A(13) > D > B > _____ > G(7) > _____ > _____> _____

Case 1:

A(13) > D > B > _____ > G(7) > H > F > _____

Case 2:

A(13) > D > B > _____ > G(7) > _____ > H > F

Case 3:

A(13) > D > B > _____ > G(7) > H > _____> F

The temperature of can E is more than the temperature of can H but less than the temperature of can C.

So case 1 and case 3 are invalid.

Case 2:

A(13) > D > B > C > G(7) > E > H > F


Two cans have less temperature than the temperature of can E.
